page.title: Proper Names
page.introduction: In English, some names can stand alone, like Sue or Russia. Others are like compound nouns, such as George Washington. Proper names may also contain articles and/or pre/post-positional phrases, as in the United States of America. Many languages require an article before a name. Appositives, possibly including a possessor, as in my son, David, also occur. In addition, proper names can be modified by adjectives and relative clauses, as in the good, old USA or the Susan Welch that I know.
